master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/mesos. If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard host:port patterns, like localhost:5050 or 10.0.0.5:5050,10.0.0.6:5050, are also acceptable.

enabled.description: Set to true to enable the Spark history server.

log-dir.description: Base directory in which Spark events are logged if spark.history-server.enabled is set to true. Users may want to set this to a unified location like an HDFS directory so history files can be read by the history server. Note that this directory must exist prior to installing the Spark package.

cleaner-enabled.description: Specifies whether the History Server should periodically clean up event logs from storage.

cleaner-interval.description: How often the job history cleaner checks for files to delete. Files are only deleted if they are older than spark.history-server.cleaner-maxage.

cleaner-maxage.description: Job history files older than this will be deleted when the history cleaner runs.

dns-suffix.description: This value is appended to the framework-name value to form the canonical DNS name for the Spark components.

framework-name.description: The name of the framework. Until this is configurable, please do not change this from it's default value.

host.description: The host that the Spark cluster dispatcher will register under.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Marathon instance.

instances.description: Number of Marathon instances to run.

mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Marathon task.

mesos-user.description: Mesos user to run the executor under

zookeeper.description: URL to the Zookeeper that Spark cluster framework connects to persist state to. (l.e: zk://0.0.0.0:2181)

config-url.description: Base URL that serves HDFS config files (hdfs-site.xml, core-site.xml).  If not set, DCOS Spark will use its default configuration and read from DCOS HDFS.
